name: Livraria Lello
description: One of the world's most beautiful bookstores, featuring stunning neo-Gothic architecture and a famous red staircase.

name: Clerigos Tower
description: Iconic baroque bell tower offering panoramic views of Porto after climbing 240 steps.
address: R. de Sao Filipe de Nery, 4050-546 Porto, Portugal

name: Ribeira District Walk
description: Stroll along the colorful Ribeira waterfront, a UNESCO World Heritage Site along the Douro River.

name: Dom Luis I Bridge
description: Double-deck iron bridge spanning the Douro River with walkable upper deck and sweeping views.
address: Ponte de Dom Luis I, Porto, Portugal

name: Sandeman Port Wine Cellar Tour
description: Guided tour and tasting at one of the most famous port wine cellars in Vila Nova de Gaia.
address: Largo Miguel Bombarda 3, 4430-175 Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal

name: Bolhao Market
description: Renovated traditional market hall with fresh produce, local cheeses, cured meats, and flowers.

name: Sao Bento Railway Station
description: Working train station famous for its entrance hall decorated with 20,000 azulejo tiles depicting Portuguese history.
address: Praca de Almeida Garrett, 4000-069 Porto, Portugal

name: Serralves Museum
description: Contemporary art museum set in beautiful gardens and a striking modernist building by Alvaro Siza.
address: R. Dom Joao de Castro 210, 4150-417 Porto, Portugal

name: Francesinha at Cafe Santiago
description: Try Porto's iconic Francesinha sandwich, a hearty dish with layers of meat, cheese, and spicy sauce.
address: R. de Passos Manuel 226, 4000-382 Porto, Portugal

name: Douro River Cruise
description: Relaxing six-bridge cruise along the Douro River with views of Porto and Vila Nova de Gaia.

name: Porto Cathedral (Se do Porto)
description: Romanesque cathedral dating to the 12th century with a Gothic cloister decorated with azulejo tiles.

name: Crystal Palace Gardens
description: Beautiful public gardens with stunning viewpoints over the Douro River and a modernist pavilion.
address: R. de Dom Manuel II, 4050-346 Porto, Portugal

name: Matosinhos Beach & Seafood
description: Sandy beach near Porto followed by fresh grilled seafood at the many beachside restaurants.

name: Igreja do Carmo
description: 18th-century church famous for its large side wall covered in intricate blue-and-white azulejo tiles.
